__compat.title: OSC 0
__compat.description: Set icon name and window title

xterm.notes: OSC 0 sets both icon name and window title (OSC_IconBoth in misc.c:3480)

kitty.notes: Sets both icon and window title

wezterm.notes: OSC 0 SetIconNameAndWindowTitle - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:34,306,458

foot.notes: Sets icon and window title, osc.c:1299-1301

alacritty.notes: Icon names not supported per escape_support.md:95

windows_terminal.notes: SetIconAndWindowTitle case in ActionOscDispatch, calls SetWindowTitle

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4686, sets window title (ignores icon title)

bobcat.notes: WhenTitle callback set up from initial release

putty.notes: Sets both icon and window title (terminal.c:3203-3214)

contour.notes: Sets both icon and window title

rxvt_unicode.notes: Sets both icon name and window title

xterm.notes: OSC 2 sets window title only (OSC_TitleOnly in misc.c:3482)

wezterm.notes: OSC 2 SetWindowTitle - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:35,307,460

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4686, sets window title

bobcat.notes: WhenTitle callback set up from initial release

xterm.notes: OSC 4 changes/queries ANSI color palette entries (OSC_SetAnsiColor in misc.c:3484)

wezterm.notes: OSC 4 ChangeColorNumber with query support - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:46,201-224,364,462

konsole.notes: ReportColors enum value 4 in src/Vt102Emulation.h:190, handled in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:1200-1222

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4687, change/query color palette entries

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

putty.notes: Query only (OSC 4;n;?) supported; setting colors not implemented

contour.notes: Change/query color palette entries

rxvt_unicode.notes: Supports querying and setting palette colors

st.notes: Supports both set and query operations

rio.notes: Supports both changing and querying with '?' for palette indices

xterm.notes: No evidence in documentation or source code

foot.notes: Current working directory via URI, osc.c:1372-1375, 457-476

alacritty.notes: Not listed in escape_support.md OSC section

vte.notes: OSC 7 (VTECWD) handled in vteseq.cc for CWD reporting

windows_terminal.notes: Not in OscActionCodes enum; falls through to default case (ignored)

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4734-4765, current working directory reporting

bobcat.notes: WhenDirectoryChange callback for shell integration added in commit 3d1c706

contour.notes: Current working directory reporting

rio.notes: Parses file:// URL and extracts path for current working directory

xterm.notes: No evidence in documentation or source code

kitty.notes: Hyperlinks with full id and url support

wezterm.notes: OSC 8 SetHyperlink - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:39,316,468

vte.notes: OSC 8 (VTEHYPER) handled in vteseq.cc for hyperlinks

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4873-4881, hyperlinks (clickable links)

bobcat.notes: WhenLink callback and Hyperlinks() enabled from initial release

contour.notes: Hyperlinks with optional parameters

rio.notes: Supports id parameter for linking related hyperlinks

xterm.notes: No evidence in documentation or source code

wezterm.notes: OSC 9 SystemNotification (ConEmu/iTerm2) - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:43,318-350,470

alacritty.notes: Not listed in escape_support.md OSC section

vte.notes: OSC 9 basic notification not implemented, only 9;4 for progress

konsole.notes: ConEmu OSC 9 recognized but only OSC 9;4 (progress) is implemented in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:1821-1855; simple notification form not implemented

mintty.notes: Not implemented (ConEmu/iTerm2 desktop notification)

bobcat.notes: WhenMessage callback for desktop notifications added in commit 4a78353

contour.notes: ConEmu-style notification and progress (OSC 9;4 included)

xterm.notes: No evidence in documentation or source code

kitty.notes: OSC 9;4 progress reporting explicitly discarded per changelog

wezterm.notes: OSC 9;4 ConEmuProgress for progress reporting - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:52,319-347,608-612

foot.notes: ConEmu/Windows Terminal progress explicitly ignored in osc.c:1389

alacritty.notes: Not listed in escape_support.md OSC section

vte.notes: OSC 9;4 progress reporting handled via conemu_extension

windows_terminal.notes: DoConEmuAction subParam 4 calls SetTaskbarProgress for progress reporting

konsole.notes: ConEmu OSC 9;4 progress reporting in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:1825-1851

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:5149-5220, progress reporting (OSC 9;4)

bobcat.notes: WhenProgress callback added in commit 2d4399a

contour.notes: Progress reporting via OSC 9;4 (ConEmu format)

xterm.notes: OSC 10 changes VT100 text foreground color (OSC_TEXT_FG=10 in ptyx.h:1018)

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4700, set/query default foreground color

bobcat.notes: DynamicColors() enabled from v0.9.0, but actual OSC 10/11/12 handling is in TerminalCtrl library

rxvt_unicode.notes: Supports querying and setting default foreground color

st.notes: Supports both set and query operations

rio.notes: Supports both setting and querying with '?'

foot.notes: Query/set background color with alpha, osc.c:1398-1478

bobcat.notes: DynamicColors() enabled from v0.9.0, but actual OSC 10/11/12 handling is in TerminalCtrl library

contour.notes: Set/query default background color

rxvt_unicode.notes: Supports querying and setting default background color

st.notes: Supports both set and query operations

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4720, set/query cursor color

cy.notes: Code exists but is commented out

bobcat.notes: DynamicColors() enabled from v0.9.0, but actual OSC 10/11/12 handling is in TerminalCtrl library

contour.notes: Set/query cursor color

st.notes: Supports both set and query operations

xterm.notes: OSC 22 changes pointer cursor shape via pointerShape resource (OSC_SetupPointer=22 in misc.c:3487)

wezterm.notes: OSC 22 (mouse pointer cursor shape) not found in codebase

alacritty.notes: Not listed in escape_support.md OSC section

vte.notes: OSC 22 listed as unsupported in vteseq.cc case statement

windows_terminal.notes: Not in OscActionCodes enum; no mouse pointer shape handling found

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4864-4867, set mouse pointer cursor style

tmux.notes: Mouse pointer cursor shape not implemented

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: Not implemented - no OSC 22 handler found

rxvt_unicode.notes: Only OSC 13/14 for pointer fg/bg colors, not OSC 22

rio.notes: Sets mouse pointer cursor shape using CursorIcon enum

xterm.notes: OSC 52 manipulates selection data (clipboard). Requires OPT_PASTE64 compile flag and allowWindowOps resource (OSC_SelectionData=52 in misc.c:3496)

kitty.notes: Clipboard write with extended OSC 5522 support

wezterm.notes: OSC 52 ManipulateSelectionData for clipboard write - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/osc.rs:42,170-183,317,484

foot.notes: Clipboard write with security config, osc.c:27-107

alacritty.notes: Only clipboard and primary selection per escape_support.md:104

vte.notes: OSC 52 listed as unsupported in vteseq.cc case statement

konsole.notes: Clipboard enum value 52 in src/Vt102Emulation.h:193, write (copy) in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:1276-1283

mintty.notes: Implemented at termout.c:4556-4617, clipboard write via OSC 52 (requires AllowSetSelection config option)

bobcat.notes: PermitClipboardWrite() option exists, but actual OSC 52 handling is in TerminalCtrl library

contour.notes: Clipboard write/copy operations

mlterm.notes: Requires user permission via allow_osc52 option

rxvt_unicode.notes: Not implemented; clipboard handled via X11 selections

xterm.notes: OSC 52 with '?' parameter for reading selection. Requires allowWindowOps resource

kitty.notes: Uses OSC 5522 for reading, standard OSC 52 for writing

wezterm.notes: OSC 52 write (SetSelection) is supported, but QuerySelection is parsed but not handled (empty handler at performer.rs:788)

foot.notes: Requires security.osc52 config option set to enabled or paste-enabled

alacritty.notes: Disabled by default; requires terminal.osc52 config

iterm2.notes: Query support implemented - OSC 52 with ? parameter triggers terminalReportPasteboard callback

vte.notes: OSC 52 is recognized but falls through to default case (ignored)

windows_terminal.notes: OSC 52 write is supported, but query (read) is parsed and ignored

konsole.notes: OSC 52 write (copy to clipboard) is supported, but OSC 52 read (query clipboard) is not implemented

mintty.notes: OSC 52 read (?) is implemented at src/termout.c:4577-4594. Requires cfg.allow_paste_selection

cy.notes: Write only; query returns 'not supported yet'

bobcat.notes: PermitClipboardRead() option exists, but actual OSC 52 handling is in TerminalCtrl library

putty.notes: OSC 52 write (copy to clipboard) is supported, but OSC 52 read (query clipboard) is not implemented

contour.notes: OSC 52 clipboard write is supported (v0.1.0), but reading/querying clipboard is explicitly not supported (comment in code: 'Only setting clipboard contents is supported, not reading')

mlterm.notes: OSC 52 only supports writing (set_selection), not reading clipboard content

screen.notes: OSC 52 for clipboard operations is not implemented

rxvt_unicode.notes: Available via Perl extension (clipboard-osc), not built into core

st.notes: Only writes to clipboard (OSC 52 set), does not respond with clipboard content for read operations

zellij.notes: OSC 52 write (copy to clipboard) is supported, but read (paste from clipboard with '?') is explicitly not implemented - see grid.rs:2784-2786

tuios.notes: Uses Bubbletea's tea.ReadClipboard API which sends OSC 52 queries, but the VT emulator itself doesn't implement OSC 52 read handling

xterm.notes: Reset color palette entry (OSC 104)

wezterm.notes: Reset color palette entries

mintty.notes: OSC 104 palette reset implemented at src/termout.c:4698

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

putty.notes: Not found in do_osc handler; only Linux palette sequences (OSC P/R) and OSC 4 query are implemented

contour.notes: OSC 104 RCOLPAL (reset color palette) is implemented in Functions.h line 647 and handled in Screen.cpp line 4027

rxvt_unicode.notes: OSC 39/49 (restoreFG/restoreBG) provide similar functionality but not standard OSC 104

zellij.notes: Supports both resetting individual color indices and all colors when no parameters given

rio.notes: Resets all 256 colors when no parameter given, or specific indices when provided

xterm.notes: OSC 110/111/112 reset foreground/background/cursor color

wezterm.notes: OSC 110-119 reset dynamic colors including foreground (110), background (111), and cursor (112)

iterm2.notes: OSC 110, 111, 112 reset foreground/background/cursor colors via XTERMCC_RESET_VT100_TEXT_*_COLOR tokens

windows_terminal.notes: OSC 110, 111, 112, 117 for resetting foreground, background, cursor, and highlight colors

konsole.notes: OSC 110 (reset fg), 111 (reset bg), and 112 (reset cursor color) are all supported

mintty.notes: OSC 110/111/112 color resets implemented at src/termout.c:4726-4728

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: OSC 110 (RCOLORFG), 111 (RCOLORBG), and 112 (RCOLORCURSOR) are all implemented in Functions.h lines 642-643,641 and handled in Screen.cpp lines 4046-4048

mlterm.notes: Code is present but commented out with #if 0

terminology.notes: Recognized but no implementation, only debug logging

rxvt_unicode.notes: OSC 39/49 reset fg/bg colors but not standard OSC 110/111/112 format

zellij.notes: OSC 110/111/112 are explicitly marked as unimplemented (grid.rs:2828-2841)

rio.notes: OSC 110, 111, and 112 all supported for resetting foreground, background, and cursor colors

xterm.notes: Shell integration (FinalTerm semantic zones) not implemented

wezterm.notes: FinalTerm semantic zones for shell integration

foot.notes: FinalTerm semantic zones (FTCS_PROMPT, FTCS_COMMAND_START, FTCS_COMMAND_EXECUTED, FTCS_COMMAND_FINISHED)

iterm2.notes: FinalTerm shell integration via XTERMCC_FINAL_TERM token

vte.notes: Full iTerm2 shell integration support (A/B/C/D/L modes)

windows_terminal.notes: Supports FinalTerm sequences A, B, C, D for shell integration

konsole.notes: Fully supports FinalTerm semantic prompts with REPL mode tracking for prompt (A/N/P), input (B), output (C), and completion (D)

mintty.notes: No implementation found for OSC 133 shell integration

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: OSC 133 shell integration (SEMA) is implemented in Functions.h line 648, handled via processShellIntegration() in Screen.cpp line 4057, supporting prompt markers (A, B, C, D)

zellij.notes: No OSC 133 shell integration support found

rio.notes: Shell integration markers are documented as not implemented (commented out in docs)

xterm.notes: Kitty color protocol not implemented

wezterm.notes: No evidence of OSC 21 support in code

iterm2.notes: No OSC 21 color query protocol implementation found

mintty.notes: No implementation found for Kitty OSC 21 color protocol

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: No evidence of Kitty OSC 21 color stack protocol implementation found in codebase

mlterm.notes: OSC 21 exists but for Eterm compatibility, not Kitty color protocol

zellij.notes: No Kitty OSC 21 color protocol support found

xterm.notes: Kitty desktop notifications not implemented

ghostty.notes: Not implemented, OSC 9 is used for desktop notifications

kitty.notes: Rich desktop notifications with icons, buttons, etc.

wezterm.notes: No evidence of Kitty OSC 99 support

foot.notes: Rich desktop notifications with full Kitty protocol support

iterm2.notes: No Kitty OSC 99 desktop notification support found

konsole.notes: Rich desktop notifications with buttons, urgency levels, and focus conditions

mintty.notes: No implementation found for Kitty OSC 99 desktop notifications

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: Kitty OSC 99 desktop notifications (DESKTOPNOTIFY) implemented in Functions.h line 657 and Screen.cpp line 4055, uses D-Bus backend

zellij.notes: No Kitty OSC 99 notification support found

xterm.notes: iTerm2 inline images not implemented

wezterm.notes: iTerm2 inline image protocol via OSC 1337 File

iterm2.notes: Inline images via OSC 1337 File= handled through XTERMCC_MULTITOKEN_HEADER_SET_KVP

vte.notes: OSC 1337 recognized but falls through to default case (ignored)

konsole.notes: Supports inline images and media playback via File= protocol with ReportCellSize query

mintty.notes: iTerm2 OSC 1337 File inline images implemented at src/termout.c:4950-5096

bobcat.notes: InlineImages() enabled from initial release, relies on TerminalCtrl library implementation

contour.notes: No iTerm2 OSC 1337 File protocol implementation found. Only Sixel (DCS DECSIXEL) graphics format is supported

zellij.notes: No iTerm2 OSC 1337 File inline image support found

xterm.notes: iTerm2 proprietary extensions not implemented

wezterm.notes: Supports SetMark, SetUserVar, CurrentDir, SetProfile, Copy, and other iTerm2 features

iterm2.notes: OSC 1337 for marks, user vars, profile switching via XTERMCC_SET_KVP token

vte.notes: OSC 1337 recognized but falls through to default case (ignored)

konsole.notes: Only File= is implemented; marks (SetMark), user vars (SetUserVar), and profile switching are not supported

mintty.notes: Only Capabilities query (src/termout.c:4959) is implemented. SetMark, SetUserVar, CurrentDir, etc. not found

xterm_js.notes: Only File protocol supported via addon

tmux.notes: DSR 1337 was removed in 3.2, replaced by CSI > q

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: No iTerm2 OSC 1337 proprietary features (marks, user vars, profile switching) found. Uses standard OSC 133 for shell integration instead

mlterm.notes: Only SetMark is supported; other features like user vars and profile switching are not implemented

zellij.notes: No iTerm2 OSC 1337 marks/user vars support found

rio.notes: Only inline image display (File=) is implemented; marks, user vars, and profile switching are not supported

xterm.notes: urxvt-style notifications not implemented

wezterm.notes: urxvt-style notifications (RxvtExtension)

vte.notes: Requires enable-legacy-osc777 property; translates to termprops

konsole.notes: Supports urxvt-style notifications and container detection (toolbox/distrobox push/pop)

mintty.notes: No implementation found for OSC 777 urxvt notifications

bobcat.notes: Would be handled by underlying TerminalCtrl library, not directly in Bobcat code

contour.notes: OSC 777 urxvt-style notifications (NOTIFY) implemented in Functions.h line 638 and Screen.cpp lines 4054,3056-3066, expects format 'notify;title;message'

rxvt_unicode.notes: URxvt_perl - for Perl extensions with 'extension-name;' format
